id: SoftBank Targets $20 Billion IPO for Japanese Mobile Unit
paragraph: November 17, 2018TOKYO—SoftBank Group Corp. said it would seek to raise more than $20 billion with the initial public offering of its Japanese mobile unit, as it hunts for funds to fuel its nearly $100 billion investment machine.The proposed IPO shows how SoftBank, which is planning to give up control of Sprint Corp. in the U.S., is cashing out of its slower-growing assets so Chief Executive Masayoshi Son can focus on a technology portfolio that already includes a stake in Uber Technologies Inc.WSJ MembershipCustomer ServiceTools & FeaturesAdsMore
